column1: Our communities have done an incredible job helping Hoosiers get back on their feet after the COVID-19 shutdown. Now strengthening our local infrastructure is a key component of delivering jobs and economic development to Indiana https://t.co/GAk46nxDND https://t.co/bDsROJQ14U

We had a great conversation today during our virtual roundtable on international trade updates to rural broadband and what the next coronavirus relief bill might mean for our state's agriculture community. Thank you to all Hoosier farmers who joined today! @INFarmBureau https://t.co/jjv9NeOQZ5

As we continue our recovery from the coronavirus economic shutdown I toured downtown Seymour to discuss what the city is working on to increase jobs and opportunities here and maintain a vibrant downtown for Hoosiers both local and visitors to enjoy ➡️ https://t.co/4b7Rw8OclL https://t.co/kD87pdtwv4
At home learning during coronavirus highlighted this lack of access to reliable internet for many families who now need it to access the classroom.

By including the DRIVE-Safe Act in the STARTER Act Republicans are putting jobs and economic growth at the forefront of their surface transportation legislation which is especially vital as we rebuild our post-coronavirus economy: https://t.co/xPNgw47XLM https://t.co/85QRFkm8QO
To everybody who was and still is on the frontlines of coronavirus thank you for your commitment to our communities our health and our safety.
For the past few months our communities have been all hands on deck to help others through the health risks and uncertainty posed by the coronavirus pandemic.

The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) just announced that rural health clinics in Indiana will receive $3 million for coronavirus testing programs thanks to the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act ➡️https://t.co/bOzi8V5Onb

To date Congress has provided $765 billion in state + local funding to aid in our fight against coronavirus. Part of our federal response has been helping local + state governments respond to this pandemic in the best way possible for their own communities. https://t.co/s1D5fSBx3S
Availability of coronavirus testing plays an important part in opening back up our country so people can get back to work. (1/2)

Happy #NationalNursesDay to all Hoosier nurses who have been working tirelessly on the frontlines of coronavirus. Thank you for seeing your patients + their families through this difficult time and for always putting others first. We are eternally grateful.   📸: @meadowshospital https://t.co/WPJbMhuUly

I joined @thehill Coronavirus Special Report w/@SCClemons to discuss the importance of finding the right balance of minimizing coronavirus health risks while still enabling and empowering Americans to get back to their normal way of life. Tune in: https://t.co/QzPpL3gdZs

🚨Signed into law: @POTUS just signed the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act to:  ✅Increase PPP funding for small businesses ✅Support our care providers and hospital systems ✅Allocate more resources to get more Americans tested for coronavirus

I hear from Hoosiers every day who are worried about feeding their families and saving their jobs. We have to recognize and have a conversation about the real economic cost of coronavirus and find a way to minimize both the economic costs and biological risks at the same time → https://t.co/eck46V44bx

Sheltering in place forever is not a sustainable strategy. It was a strategy meant to buy time. It was a strategy meant to flatten the curve. But it’s not a strategy that we can sit at home and wait for the coronavirus to pass. → https://t.co/UlCKg7D7ql

We owe Americans a reasonable thoughtful plan based in science to balance the health risks of coronavirus with the economic losses of people’s jobs and businesses and ability to support their children and go to church. As a country we need a way forward. https://t.co/lKbXvm6im9

Good news of the day☀️ Bryan’s whole neighborhood in Franklin welcomed him home after 10 days on a ventilator because of Coronavirus. I just spoke to Bryan on the phone and he was in bright spirits happy to be home and optimistic about our country’s ability to fight this virus. https://t.co/d779qi0rRO

I joined Bloomberg Radio to discuss ensuring this $2 trillion of taxpayer money from the CARES Act is used efficiently and effectively in combatting Coronavirus. You work hard for the money you send to Washington – it always needs to be working for you: https://t.co/xQg4R5eFhK

If you visit my website at https://t.co/xwTyB8f3BM you can find information on everything from how to apply for unemployment insurance to resources for veteran healthcare during coronavirus. My team is updating this site daily with new information and the latest guidance.

Hoosiers as we work together to fight coronavirus there are numerous resources available from the Indiana state government the federal government and the private sector to help lessen the burden on Hoosiers and help families through this tough time.

Today @GovHolcomb announced a statewide order for Hoosiers to stay home in an effort to stop the spread of coronavirus. Head to my website for FAQs on what this stay at home order means for you and your family → https://t.co/umRPGQCNHV https://t.co/3BpmRHE0uf

Huber’s Starlight Distillery is repurposing its bourbon distilling process to make hand sanitizer and help keep Hoosiers safe and prevent the spread of coronavirus. Thank you Huber’s for your contribution to our fight against coronavirus → https://t.co/yEouXe5kmO

We have a duty in Congress to keep Americans safe help our economy heal & help Hoosiers stay on their feet. I voted tonight for the Families First Coronavirus Response Act to provide necessary and affirmative relief to all sectors of our economy and employees affected. (2/2)

The deep economic uncertainty caused by social distancing – a necessary effort encouraged by medical professionals to prevent the further spread of coronavirus - is hurting all sectors of our economy including our small businesses. (1/2)

Latest update from the CDC – Indiana is receiving $10 million from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to assist our state and local health departments who are on the frontlines of our coronavirus response efforts ➡️ https://t.co/qc45jiMTim

Washing our hands is a simple but effective way to stay healthy during the coronavirus outbreak. Learn more about our country's all-hands-on-deck approach to the coronavirus and what you and I can do to prevent it from spreading here → https://t.co/Ft2MRpqOpf https://t.co/mQiShsBP5m

ICYMI: I joined @DanSpehler on @INFocusIndiana to discuss our efforts in Congress to deploy the resources necessary for Hoosiers including hospitals and first responders to stay healthy amid the #coronavirus outbreak. Listen here: https://t.co/hL7c9YyFoV
On @BloombergTV: We have to make sure our supplemental funding for #coronavirus is a real and proactive policy response not a political tool. https://t.co/npVVVCM9J9

I joined @DavidWestin on @BloombergTV to discuss this morning's Federal Reserve rate cuts. I applaud the Fed in taking preemptive action to ensure we stabilize any economic outcomes because of #coronavirus. https://t.co/aKB8uLJwxI
